Is this a bug report or feature request?
<!-- Remove only one -->
* Bug Report

**Bug Report**

What happened:

New mon0 running with 127.0.0.1 addr on bare metal cluster

What you expected to happen:

mon0 should start with ips assigned by cluster

How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->

After some installs, new rook operator (master channel) create first rook-ceph-mon0 with 127.0.0.1 ips.
Logs in rook-ceph-mon0 pod:
```
2018-06-24 10:26:26.294473 I | mkfs-rook-ceph-mon0: 2018-06-24 10:26:26.293463 7f0d40d4dec0  0 ceph-mon: created monfs at /var/lib/rook/rook-ceph-mon0/data for mon.rook-ceph-mon0
2018-06-24 10:26:26.298266 I | cephmon: starting mon
2018-06-24 10:26:26.298474 I | cephmon: Config file /var/lib/rook/rook-ceph-mon0/rook-ceph.config:
[global]
fsid                      = bd06f4ab-b504-462e-999a-f55feed009df
run dir                   = /var/lib/rook/rook-ceph-mon0
mon initial members       = rook-ceph-mon0
mon host                  = 127.0.0.1:6790
log file                  = /dev/stdout
mon cluster log file      = /dev/stdout
public addr               = 127.0.0.1
cluster addr              = 127.0.0.1
mon keyvaluedb            = rocksdb
mon_allow_pool_delete     = true
mon_max_pg_per_osd        = 1000
debug default             = 0
debug rados               = 0
debug mon                 = 0
debug osd                 = 0
debug bluestore           = 0
debug filestore           = 0
debug journal             = 0
debug leveldb             = 0
filestore_omap_backend    = rocksdb
osd pg bits               = 11
osd pgp bits              = 11
osd pool default size     = 1
osd pool default min size = 1
osd pool default pg num   = 100
osd pool default pgp num  = 100
osd objectstore           = 
rbd_default_features      = 3
fatal signal handlers     = false
 [client.admin]
keyring = /var/lib/rook/rook-ceph-mon0/keyring
 2018-06-24 10:26:26.298496 I | exec: Running command: ceph-mon --foreground --name=mon.rook-ceph-mon0 --cluster=rook-ceph --mon-data=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph-mon0/data --conf=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph-mon0/rook-ceph.config --keyring=/var/lib/rook/rook-ceph-mon0/keyring --public-addr=127.0.0.1:6790 --public-bind-addr=127.0.0.1:6790
```

cluster.yaml:
```
apiVersion: v1
kind: Namespace
metadata:
  name: rook-ceph
---
apiVersion: ceph.rook.io/v1alpha1
kind: Cluster
metadata:
  name: rook-ceph
  namespace: rook-ceph
spec:
  dataDirHostPath: /var/lib/rook
  network:
    hostNetwork: false
  dashboard:
    enabled: true
  storage:
    useAllNodes: true
    useAllDevices: false
    deviceFilter: ^sd[b-c]
```
operator.yaml: 
```
apiVersion: apps/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: rook-ceph-operator
  namespace: rook-ceph-system
  labels:
    operator: rook
    storage-backend: ceph
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: rook-ceph-operator
    spec:
      serviceAccountName: rook-ceph-operator
      containers:
      - name: rook-ceph-operator
        image: rook/ceph:master
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        args: ["ceph", "operator"]
        env:
        - name: FLEXVOLUME_DIR_PATH
          value: "/var/lib/kubelet/volume-plugins/"
        - name: ROOK_ALLOW_MULTIPLE_FILESYSTEMS
          value: "false"
        - name: ROOK_MON_HEALTHCHECK_INTERVAL
          value: "30s"
        - name: ROOK_MON_OUT_TIMEOUT
          value: "300s"
        - name: NODE_NAME
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: spec.nodeName
        - name: POD_NAME
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
```

```
kubectl get all -n rook-ceph -o wide
NAME                       READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE       IP               NODE
pod/rook-ceph-mon0-cv28s   1/1       Running   0          5m        10.233.102.180   node1

NAME                     TYPE        CLUSTER-IP      EXTERNAL-IP   PORT(S)    AGE       SELECTOR
service/rook-ceph-mon0   ClusterIP   10.233.41.109   <none>        6790/TCP   5m        app=rook-ceph-mon,mon=rook-ceph-mon0,mon_cluster=rook-ceph

NAME                             DESIRED   CURRENT   READY     AGE       CONTAINERS      IMAGES             SELECTOR
replicaset.apps/rook-ceph-mon0   1         1         1         5m        rook-ceph-mon   rook/ceph:master   app=rook-ceph-mon,mon=rook-ceph-mon0,mon_cluster=rook-ceph
```

Because mon running with localhost listener, its impossible to connect from operator:
```
[root@rook-ceph-operator-75c77b4cf6-bp4rb /]# telnet 10.233.102.180 6790
Trying 10.233.102.180...
telnet: connect to address 10.233.102.180: Connection refused
```

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.13.0-45-generic x86_64
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: bare metal, 4 hosts
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): v0.7.0-188.g44514be
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.10.2
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): kubespray
title: New mon0 running with 127.0.0.1 addr on bare metal cluster
